_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.    Facility accidental release and emergency response policy. The management and employees of South Central FS, Inc are committed to prevention of accidental releases of Anhydrous Ammonia. If any accidental release should occur. The facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Local Emergency planning Committee or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2.    The stationary source and the regulated substances handled. The primary activity at the facility which is located at North Main Street, Humbolt Illinois is the storage and blending of fertilizer for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient. The storage and handling systems consists of one AA? 30,000gallon storage tank, and one loading riser, and associated plumbing and nurse tanks.

3.    The accidental release prevention program. This facility complies withy EPAs Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and regulations. This facility has implemented the provisions of Safety requirements for the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia, K-61.1, published by the American National Standards Institute Inc.  as adopted by State regulations and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA). 29 CFR 1910.111, AA?Storage and Handling of Anhydrous AmmoniaAA?. Compliance with these regulations and on-going training of our employees make up our accident release prevention program.

4.    Five year accident history. There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage to the facility nor to our knowledge, have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries. There was an accidental release from the main storage tank on 10/24/2020 starting at 9:13 am that lasted 1 hour and 22 minutes, releasing 266 pounds of anh

ydrous ammonia the release caused first responders to initiate evacuations of approx. home and one school. There was no shelter in place, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.    The Emergency Response Program. The facility has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA Standard, 29CFR 1910.38 and have provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right to know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA)

6.    Planned changes to improve safety. Our company Safety and compliance division promoted a anhydrous ammonia safety training with our local fire departments at the facility and instructed the first responders on the basic principles of anhydrous ammonia and how to safely respond and react to released with this product. Safety improvement is an on going process at the facility, Periodic evaluations are performed to access the maintenance of safe conditions, There are no specific safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
